body:
Hello,

Recently, an immense amount of community members have been attempting to bypass our death threat rule by saying "kill yourselfie." This is honestly disappointing behavior that will not be tolerated. Staff members will continue to punish as usual with no exceptions to this rule. A one-week grace period will be in place where staff members should issue a warn before any punishment regarding these matters, but after it passes, immediate punishments will be given. Thanks.

Regards,
Senior Staff
body_tagged:
Hello,

Recently, an immense amount of community members have been attempting to bypass our death threat rule by saying "kill yourselfie." This is honestly disappointing behavior that will not be tolerated. Staff members will continue to punish as usual with no exceptions to this rule. A one-week grace period will be in place where staff members should issue a warn before any punishment regarding these matters, but after it passes, immediate punishments will be given. Thanks.

Regards,
Senior Staff
title: Regarding Death Threats/Suicide Encouragement

replies.body:
Well, I thought it was going to be smooth sailing for a while, but NOPE. And to those people who have said something like this, I have a quote from a previous Avicus thread pertaining to the same issue addressed here:
"Did you maybe ever think for a slight second that this person might actually do it? How would you live with yourself afterwards?"
-FrozenSolstice, I believe.
And yes I know the quote is kinda cliche, but I know at least I would feel no emotion but guilt if I ever knew that I was the cause of a suicide.

If it's because you're having a bad day ingame or just a bad day in general, and are just purely annoyed at the game/life/whatever, let your frustration out in ways other than telling people to kill themselves.

Also, please don't start a flame war on this thread...it hasn't happened yet, but I have a bad feeling that one's going to erupt soon due to the nature of it...
replies.body_tagged:

-FrozenSolstice, I believe.
And yes I know the quote is kinda cliche, but I know at least I would feel no emotion but guilt if I ever knew that I was the cause of a suicide.

If it's because you're having a bad day ingame or just a bad day in general, and are just purely annoyed at the game/life/whatever, let your frustration out in ways other than telling people to kill themselves.

Also, please don't start a flame war on this thread...it hasn't happened yet, but I have a bad feeling that one's going to erupt soon due to the nature of it...

replies.body: We're not accusing every single player of using it in that manner, but it will be used by some to bypass the rule indefinitely. Even a server like Kohi, with the most toxic chat out of any MC I've seen does not tolerate suicide encouragement and does not put up with bypasses, loopholes and technicalities. The whole point of this is to make it public the loophole is shutting and we're putting our foot down as a staff team, which is a step in the right direction if you ask me, since the whole loophole game has gone on far too long.
replies.body_tagged: We're not accusing every single player of using it in that manner, but it will be used by some to bypass the rule indefinitely. Even a server like Kohi, with the most toxic chat out of any MC I've seen does not tolerate suicide encouragement and does not put up with bypasses, loopholes and technicalities. The whole point of this is to make it public the loophole is shutting and we're putting our foot down as a staff team, which is a step in the right direction if you ask me, since the whole loophole game has gone on far too long.

replies.body:
As someone who once knew a victim of cyber bullying, all I ask is that you respect these boundaries. I know you may think playfully bypassing the rules is harmless and isn't going to affect anyone, but trust me, it takes a huge fucking impact on some people. You don't know what they're going through. A simple trigger is all it takes.

In memory & honour of my friend and all those out there who have been victims of it, please, just don't do it. It's not hard. If being a troll over such a matter is something you can't resist then I think you need a bit of help.
replies.body_tagged:
As someone who once knew a victim of cyber bullying, all I ask is that you respect these boundaries. I know you may think playfully bypassing the rules is harmless and isn't going to affect anyone, but trust me, it takes a huge fucking impact on some people. You don't know what they're going through. A simple trigger is all it takes.

In memory & honour of my friend and all those out there who have been victims of it, please, just don't do it. It's not hard. If being a troll over such a matter is something you can't resist then I think you need a bit of help.

Not the staff team.

replies.body:
Telling someone to kill themselves will never be allowed here.
Saying that "this is the internet" doesn't justify someone to tell someone else that they should end their life.

Obviously if you're talking with friends and everyone knows it's a joke with all parties giving consent, then you won't be banned.

But Cyber-bullying is a very serious issue. and telling others to "harden up, this is the internet would else would you expect?" doesn't cut it with a community whose player base ranges from 11-18 year olds.
(Kids who aren't mentally capable of dealing with insults.)

Although it may be a joke to you, you never know what the person on the receiving end is going through.

I honestly don't understand why people are arguing. 

Don't tell people to kill themselves if both parties aren't consenting. 
It's literally common sense.
